name: Erasing the Invisible
description: Evaluate robustness of invisible watermarks embedded in AI-generated images against adversarial attacks. Participants aim to remove or degrade watermarks while preserving image quality.

cr:input.name: competition_dataset
cr:input.description: Dataset consists of 600 PNG images divided equally between two tracks: Beige-box (Gaussian Shading, StegaStamp) and Black-box (JigMark, PRC, StableSignature, Trufo, and combinations like Gaussian Shading + JigMark). Metadata includes image_index and watermarked_image.

cr:output.name: attacked_images
cr:output.description: Modified PNG images minimizing watermark detection while preserving visual quality. Output includes 300 images per submission.

field.name: image_index
field.description: Unique identifier for each image, e.g., image_001.

field.name: attacked_image
field.description: URL or file path to the modified PNG image.

cr:evaluation.notes: Final score is computed as Euclidean distance in Q-A space: sqrt(Q² + A²). Lower scores indicate better performance. Q aggregates eight IQMs normalized to [0.1, 0.9], and A is derived from TPR@0.1%FPR.

open_questions: Exact Docker image used for evaluation is unclear. Paper mentions 'johnding1996/codabench-erasinginvisible:latest', but further verification is needed.
Allowed external data usage is unspecified. Are participants permitted to use pre-trained models beyond those mentioned?
fill_in_the_blank: cr:execution.allowedExternalData - external data usage policy not specified in paper
